Posts.Content: I had a Portacath fitted after suffering a blood clot in arm after my first chemo.  It has been great and never had any problems with it.  Good luck...I get mine removed tomorrow when i get my reduction of left boob to match my implant.  Louise xxx
Posts.Title: PICC Line - yes or no?

Posts.Content: Thank you! I dont know what to do but will chat to nurse in ten days time approx and go from there. xxx

Posts.Title: Diagnosed yesterday - need mastectomy August 19th :-O

Posts.Content: Thanks Disco73!!!  I bet it was scary cutting hair. Sending all my best wishes to ya!  I will keep chin up...think shock is wearing off and I'm just scared now. I really shouldn't read things - whats that saying Ignorance is Bliss lol x
Posts.Title: Diagnosed yesterday - need mastectomy August 19th :-O

Posts.Content: I went yesterday to RVI Newcastle to be told i have it in two places and need mastectomy August 19th then chemo and Herceptin treatment (not sure what this is) He said its caught early but they will check lymph nodes during operation.  It was a shock. it was picked up in my first over 50 scan.  I don't know if i want reconstruction but need to have chat with a nurse first.  Anyone else had this news? how did you cope? did you have recon? or just use prosthetic?  Thanks in advance. Lou x
